questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: During puberty, what primary histological changes occur in the breast parenchyma?
options: A. Ducts shorten and lobules shrink
B. Ducts elongate, branch, and alveoli increase
C. Only stroma increases, parenchyma remains unchanged
questions.correctAnswer: B. Ducts elongate, branch, and alveoli increase

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What is the primary change in breast stroma during puberty?
options: B. Thickening and hardening of connective tissue
C. Increase in connective tissue elasticity, vascularity, and adiposity
questions.correctAnswer: C. Increase in connective tissue elasticity, vascularity, and adiposity

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What significant microscopic change occurs in the breast parenchyma during pregnancy?
options: C. Further duct/lobule formation and increased number/size of secretory acini/alveoli
D. Increase in stromal adipose tissue
questions.correctAnswer: C. Further duct/lobule formation and increased number/size of secretory acini/alveoli

questions.question: What happens to the stromal adipose tissue during pregnancy and lactation?

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What process occurs in the breast glandular tissue when lactation ceases?
options: C. Involution and atrophy due to apoptosis
questions.correctAnswer: C. Involution and atrophy due to apoptosis

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: How does the structure of the male breast typically differ from the post-pubertal female breast?
options: A. It has fully developed lobules but lacks ducts.
B. It consists mainly of adipose tissue with no ducts.
C. It has small ducts that do not extend beyond the areola and lacks developed lobules.
D. It is identical but smaller.
questions.correctAnswer: C. It has small ducts that do not extend beyond the areola and lacks developed lobules.

questions.passage: This question does not have a passage.
questions.question: What structural changes typically occur in the female breast after menopause?
options: A. Increase in glandular tissue and decrease in fat
B. Involution of glandular tissue and increase in fatty tissue
D. Enlargement of the nipple and areola
questions.correctAnswer: B. Involution of glandular tissue and increase in fatty tissue
